Recap: Luke, Noah and Ameera get stuck on the highway going to visit Colonel Mayer in jail and they must wait for someone to come and help them. Luke is annoyed that Noah has no problem telling Ameera about his past and his hopes and dreams things he has never been able to share with him. Will isn't happy about Paul's fast friendship with Sofie and neither is Barbara who fears Sofie is going to tell Paul she has cancer. Henry catches Vienna kissing Gray and tells Brad and Katie his and Vienna's relationship has ended. Vienna admits to Katie that she doesn't love Gray but she does miss her old life which Gray can give to her. Vienna tells Katie that she has given everything up for Henry and she fears that Henry will never be ready to marry her and have children. Brad and Katie manage to get Henry and Vienna to make up and then Henry and Vienna make love. Gray leaves a message for Vienna telling her she will be in his dreams.
Transcript: Noah: Hey.
Luke: Hey. I mucked out the stalls and fed the horses. It wasn't the same without you.
Noah: I'm sorry I couldn't help. I just didn't want to leave Ameera alone.
Luke: That's okay. How's she doing?
Noah: She's napping now. She was really shaken up after that boiler backfired.
Luke: Yeah, well, I don't blame her. Can you imagine what life must have been like for her in Iraq?
Noah: We have to help her after her visa's expired.
Luke: Well, my grandma always has a bunch of lawyers on retainer. I could ask her for some advice.
Noah: You'd ask her? I mean, you'd do that for Ameera?
Luke: Sure. Why not?
Noah: Honestly, I -- I didn't know how you felt about her.
Luke: I don't have a problem with Ameera. I just wonder why she's so important to you.

Will: Hallie's sound asleep. Are you okay?

Barbara: Mm-hmm. I don't like it.
Will: I don't like it either, but it's hard to tell Paul what to do. You know, he's going to figure it out soon enough though.
Barbara: I made a very late new year's resolution. I promise I will not interfere in my sons' lives anymore.
Will: And how long do you think that's going to last?
Barbara: As long as it has to.
Gwen: Barb?
Barbara: Hmm?
Gwen: You okay? You just seem like a little tired.
Barbara: I'm fine. Just fine.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Noah: I was really lonely growing up. We moved around a lot, from Army base to Army base. I always wished I had a brother or a sister, you know, just someone my age.
Luke: Look out!
[Tires screech]
Noah: Are you guys okay?
Luke: Did we hit something?
Noah: I don't know. I don't know. Let's check it out.
Luke: Will this help?
Noah: Front axle is broken. This car's not going anywhere. Better call for help.
Luke: No signal.
Noah: Me either.
Ameera: Me neither. What are we going to do?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Sofie: Thank you for taking me out, and trying to cheer me up. I wish I had been better company.
Chris: No, you were fine. I like spending time with you. Let's do it again soon.
Sofie: That would be nice.
Chris: I have to get back to work. My boss is tough and I don't want to upset him.
Sofie: Okay. Hi, how ya feeling?
Paul: Okay. Sofie, my mom was just here.
Sofie: Oh, what did you talk about?
Paul: You.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Bob: Not a moment too soon.
Chris: Next time I'll be here early.
Bob: See that you are. Thanks, but I could have done that.
Chris: I know.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Paul: My mom's been acting kind of strange. Has she been giving you a hard time?
Sofie: No, not really.
Paul: Because if she's been giving you a hard time, let me know and I can take care of it.
Sofie: Thank you. Yeah, I should probably go. You're exhausted.
Paul: No, please. Will you stay? I'd like for you to read to me some more.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Gwen: Whose idea was it to go out today?
Will: Mine. But we're never going to make that mistake again. I say we stay in the house, forever.
Gwen: Oh, that is a mistake. You're going to get so sick of me.
Will: No, it'll never happen. As long as I know my two girls are safe and he, then I'm a happy man.
Gwen: That's good, 'cause as long as you're happy, I'm happy, too.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Vienna: Oh, Henry, I'm so sorry. I never should have kissed Gray like that.
Henry: Do you mean you should have kissed him less or more?
Vienna: No! No, no, I shouldn't have kissed him at all. The only man I should ever kiss is you. Oh, come on.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Katie: You missed one.
Brad: He ate all of my cheese curls.
Katie: Do you think Henry and Vienna have made up by now?
Brad: I think he's definitely going to get lucky.
Katie: I want to believe that love is worth fighting for, but it's just so easy to let it slip through your fingers.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Henry: Do you use these moves on Gray?
Vienna: No. These moves are only for you. Vienna Hyatt is otherwise engaged. Please, leave a message.
Gray: Hey, beautiful, I just wanted to say good night. You'll be in my dreams.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Ameera: I wonder if there's a gas station nearby.

Luke: No. That way is a nature preserve. And this way it's just miles of woods, and then the lake. We'd freeze walking to a gas station. I guess we have to just wait here and hope that somebody comes by and helps us.
Noah: We better get back in the truck to stay warm. What is it?
Ameera: We have to sleep in the truck?
Luke: Well, I know we have to rough it, but we don't really have a choice.
Noah: What's wrong?
Ameera: It's just --
Noah: Don't worry. Okay, we'll be complete gentlemen. I'll sleep in the middle.
[Wolf howls]
[NEXT_ON]
Carly: The only way to stop that woman is to catch her trying to kill again.
Brad: I got a plan! I have a plan!
Jack: Let's hear it.
Brad: Okay, Henry's going to seduce kit, and then we're going to nail her for killing Sam.
Kit: Kiss me first.
